added t1-isolated-d448u15-lag.

Hi @weiguo-nvidia, cloud you share the packets per second metric in results? does this change effect it?

> Hi @weiguo-nvidia, cloud you share the packets per second metric in results? does this change effect it?

Hi @w1nda , this is the test data using the new module

| Test Case | Route convergence time (seconds) | PTF packet sending rate (PPS) | Data plane down time (seconds) |
|----------------------------------------------|----------------------------------|-------------------------------|-------------------------------|
| Sessions flapping (1 port) | 20.05 | 810.118 | 0.191 |
| Sessions flapping (10 ports) | 25.84 | 974.957 | 3.535 |
| Sessions flapping (20 ports) | 26.77 | 105.600 | 0.217 |
| Device unisolation | 92.98 | 99.016 | 129.190 |
| Next hop group member scale (remove member) | 7.90 | 636.651 | 8.354 |
| Next hop group member scale (add member) | 7.03 | 915.003 | 1.802 |

> > Hi @weiguo-nvidia, cloud you share the packets per second metric in results? does this change effect it?
> 
> Hi @w1nda , this is the test data using the new module
> 
> Test Case	Route convergence time (seconds)	PTF packet sending rate (PPS)	Data plane down time (seconds)
> Sessions flapping (1 port)	20.05	810.118	0.191
> Sessions flapping (10 ports)	25.84	974.957	3.535
> Sessions flapping (20 ports)	26.77	105.600	0.217
> Device unisolation	92.98	99.016	129.190
> Next hop group member scale (remove member)	7.90	636.651	8.354
> Next hop group member scale (add member)	7.03	915.003	1.802

Thanks,

the data plane downtime longer than route convergence time at sometime, I don't understand why, do you have any concern on this?

> you have any concern The PR does not include any traffic change. 1. Data plane downtime is calculated based on BGP convergence time and PTF packet send rate. Now the BGP convergence time is shorter, I found sometimes the "PTF packet send rate (PPS)" is low, which might affect the data plan downtime 2. Do you run the test using sonic-mgmt code without this change but with PR https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/19380? What about the down time?

> > you have any concern > > The PR does not include any traffic change. > > 1. Data plane downtime is calculated based on BGP convergence time and PTF packet send rate. Now the BGP convergence time is shorter, I found sometimes the "PTF packet send rate (PPS)" is low, which might affect the data plan downtime > > > 2. Do you run the test using sonic-mgmt code without this change but with PR [[bgp-scale-test] Use different icmp type for each traffic thread to remove packet count noise #19380](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/19380)? What about the down time? Yes, this is the result with PR #19380 with t1-d510u2 topology:

> > > you have any concern > > > > > > The PR does not include any traffic change. > > > > 1. Data plane downtime is calculated based on BGP convergence time and PTF packet send rate. Now the BGP convergence time is shorter, I found sometimes the "PTF packet send rate (PPS)" is low, which might affect the data plan downtime > > > > > > 2. Do you run the test using sonic-mgmt code without this change but with PR [[bgp-scale-test] Use different icmp type for each traffic thread to remove packet count noise #19380](https://github.com/[/pull/19380](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/19380))? What about the down time? > > Yes, this is the result with PR #19380 with t1-d510u2 topology: In the origin case, it records time by `start_time = datetime.datetime.now()` and `end_time = datetime.datetime.now()`: - `start_time_1`: `start_time = datetime.datetime.now()` - `end_time_1`: `end_time = datetime.datetime.now()` In the new module `check_bgp_ipv6_routes_converged`, there is another start time and end time - `start_time_2`: before interface flap - `end_time_2`: after route convergence The BGP convergence time is `end_time_2 - start_time_2`, but the data plane down time is calculated using `end_time_1 - start_time_1`. We should also use `end_time_2 - start_time_2` to calculate data plane down time. Let me try to update it.
Azure Pipelines will not run the associated pipelines, because the pull request was updated after the run command was issued. Review the pull request again and issue a new run command.

> > > > you have any concern > > > > > > > > > The PR does not include any traffic change. > > > > > > 1. Data plane downtime is calculated based on BGP convergence time and PTF packet send rate. Now the BGP convergence time is shorter, I found sometimes the "PTF packet send rate (PPS)" is low, which might affect the data plan downtime > > > > > > > > > 2. Do you run the test using sonic-mgmt code without this change but with PR [[bgp-scale-test] Use different icmp type for each traffic thread to remove packet count noise #19380](https://github.com/[[/pull/19380](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/19380)](https://github.com/[/pull/19380](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/19380)))? What about the down time? > > > > > > Yes, this is the result with PR #19380 with t1-d510u2 topology: > > In the origin case, it records time by `start_time = datetime.datetime.now()` and `end_time = datetime.datetime.now()`: > > 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 2025 parse_prs.py parse_reviews.py pr_dump.sh `start_time_1`: `start_time = datetime.datetime.now()` > 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 2025 parse_prs.py parse_reviews.py pr_dump.sh `end_time_1`: `end_time = datetime.datetime.now()` > > In the new module `check_bgp_ipv6_routes_converged`, there is another start time and end time > > 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 2025 parse_prs.py parse_reviews.py pr_dump.sh `start_time_2`: before interface flap > 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 2025 parse_prs.py parse_reviews.py pr_dump.sh `end_time_2`: after route convergence > > The BGP convergence time is `end_time_2 - start_time_2`, but the data plane down time is calculated using `end_time_1 - start_time_1`. We should also use `end_time_2 - start_time_2` to calculate data plane down time. Let me try to update it. > > Hi @w1nda I have updated the PR. This is the latest test data, I also collect send packet / receive packet / missing packet from the log. By the way, I run case `test_device_unisolation` two times, one receive 1415 packet (send 63364), another one receive 0 packet (send 15897), but both of them are marked pass. Is it expected?

@Ndancejic Can you help me understand `During neighbor generation for the test, some of the neighbor updates were being missed from APPL_DB on sn4700 devices.` ? Is it possible that doing it in batch hides some real issue?

> @Ndancejic Can you help me understand `During neighbor generation for the test, some of the neighbor updates were being missed from APPL_DB on sn4700 devices.` ? Is it possible that doing it in batch hides some real issue?

I noticed that some of the neighbor entries being added at the start of the test were not being notified in appdb. appdb gets these from netlink when programming neighbors through the kernel. From what I understand if there's a high volume, these can be dropped from the kernel sometimes. In this case we were programming ~2000 entries in a single `ip neigh replace` command
